content.description: Stand start at the big hollow smiley in the middle of the boulder. Move straight up through a big eye and a couple horizontal cracks. Not great rock quality.
content.location: Smack dab in the center of the southern slab.

content.description: Stand start. Up the red arete on the lefthand side of the southern face. Not great rock quality.
content.location: A couple boulders to the south of The Drum Circle boulder. Problems face south.

content.description: Same start as Craggamuffin. Sit start with a right hand finger lock and left hand on the shelf just above. Make a move or two up and right, through some right facing edges, then straight up through a cool 1/2 handlebar feature.
content.location: Same start as Craggamuffin. 4 feet to the right of Go To Sleep, Go To Sleep.

content.description: Sit start matched at a neat triangular pinch block. Move up through another pinch and a side pull. Easy mantel finish. Cool moves for a shorty.

climbs.name: Go To Sleep, Go to Sleep

content.description: Hang start on the red, rightward sloping shelf at the south east overhang. Mantel it up.
content.location: The start is about 4 feet right of Boba Junkies.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a flat ledge. Climb the sharp arete to it's apex. Too bad the problem isn't taller.
content.location: The pyramidal boulder on top of the heap. The problem faces west/uphill.

content.description: Sit start with right hand finger lock and left hand on the shelf just above. Follow the rising traverse leftwards and around the arete, topping out at the same finish as Boba Junkies.
content.location: 4 feet to the right of Go To Sleep, Go to Sleep at a short, black stained horizontal crack.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched, low on the arete. Climb the arete and top out at the apex.
content.location: The pyramidal boulder on top of the heap. This problem climbs the east facing/downhill side arete.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched, on the lowest sloping crimp of the arete. Climb up leftwards through slight edges. Devious.
content.location: The boulder resting beneath the pyramidal boulder of Gimme All The Sugar. 50 feet west of the boardwalk.

content.description: Sit start hand matched on the sharp, south east arete. Work leftwards, moving through two swooping rails with the left hand and slapping along the lip with the right. Tricky mantel finish where the top flattens out..
content.location: Small satellite boulder, directly beneath The Drum Circle boulder's steep eastern overhang.

content.description: Stand start with underclings at the right slanting, undercut rail on the right side of the boulder. Climb straight up. Poor rock quality.
content.location: The right hand side of the southern slab.

content.description: This small collection of boulders (including The Drum Circle boulder) sits just above the boardwalk, west of the Red Springs meadow. The view is fantastic and the approach short.The boulders get afternoon shade as the sun drops behind the cliffside.
